youjin-c.github.io

Overall Goal: Migrate your portfolio website from CargoCollective to GitHub Pages, preserving its layout and content.

Progress in this session:

  1. Project Setup: Created a local directory /Users/youjin/portfolio-site for the project.
  2. Initial Scraping Attempt (wget):
    • We attempted to use wget to recursively download your CargoCollective site (https://youjin.cargo.site/).
    • This approach encountered limitations: it couldn’t handle dynamically loaded images (from freight.cargo.site) and struggled with internal links that were likely JavaScript-driven, resulting in many 404 errors and an incomplete scrape.
  3. Shift to Advanced Scraping (Playwright):
    • We determined that wget was insufficient due to the dynamic nature of your CargoCollective site.
    • We decided to use Playwright, a headless browser automation library, which can render pages with JavaScript and capture the fully loaded content.
  4. Environment Setup:
    • A Python virtual environment (.venv) was created inside /Users/youjin/portfolio-site.
    • playwright and beautifulsoup4 (for HTML parsing) were installed into this virtual environment.
    • html2text was installed into the virtual environment for Markdown conversion.
  5. Playwright Scraping Script Development (full_scrape.py):
    • I wrote and subsequently modified a Python script (full_scrape.py) designed to:
      • Launch a headless Chromium browser.
      • Navigate to your CargoCollective site.
      • Recursively follow internal links within the cargo.site domains.
      • Extract main content and convert it to Markdown.
      • Identify and download images, saving them to project-specific images/ subdirectories.
      • Update image paths in the generated Markdown to point to local, downloaded versions.
      • Save the Markdown content to a new markdown/ directory structure.

  6. Current Status: The full_scrape.py script has been successfully run, generating Markdown files and organizing images into project-specific subfolders.

  7. GitHub Pages Setup:
    • Guided the user to create a GitHub User Site repository (youjin-c.github.io).
    • Assisted in copying the scraped Markdown files and organized image folders into the new GitHub repository.
    • Provided instructions for creating _data/projects.yml and updating index.md to display projects in a grid layout with thumbnails, leveraging Jekyll’s data files feature.

The next step is for the user to manually create the _data/projects.yml file, update the index.md file, and then commit and push these changes to their GitHub repository to see the grid layout live.
